library

Class Library

  • java.lang.Object
    • library.Library

  • public class Library
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the container class that defines the abstract data type Library to hold library catalog and its operations. A library holds an array of Books, and this class implements several methods to add, remove, checkout, return, and display the list of Books by the date published or by the Book's serial number
    Author:
    Jasmin Kaur, Jonathan Delin

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Library()
      default constructor to create empty bag

    • Constructor Detail

      • Library

        public Library()
        default constructor to create empty bag

    • Method Detail

      • findSerial

        public java.lang.String findSerial(java.lang.String serial)
        Finds the index of a given serial number. Returns the index value of the book with that serial number as a string. Otherwise, returns invalid index value of -1 as a string.
        Parameters:
        serial, - is the serial number that is being searched for
        Returns:
        index as string if found, return invalid index value if not found.

      • add

        public void add(Book book)
        Adds Book to the book bag
        Parameters:
        book - Book that is to be added

      • remove

        public boolean remove(Book book)
        Removes the book from the book bag (array)
        Parameters:
        book - Book that is to be removed
        Returns:
        true if found and removed, false otherwise

      • checkOut

        public boolean checkOut(Book book)
        Checks if the book has been checked out by a user or not.
        Parameters:
        book, - is the book that will be checked if it has been checked out or not
        Returns:
        true if checked out or if book does not exist, false if not

      • returns

        public boolean returns(Book book)
        Allows user to return a book that they have rented.
        Parameters:
        book, - is the book that is being returned
        Returns:
        true if the book exists and has been checked out

      • sortByNumber

        public void sortByNumber()
        Sort method for arranging books in ascending order by their serial number.

      • sortByDate

        public void sortByDate()
        Sort method for arranging books in ascending order by their publish date.

      • getBooks

        public Book[] getBooks()
        Method to retrieve the books array.
        Returns:
        books, the array of books otherwise known as the bag containing all the books

      • setBooks

        public void setBooks(Book[] books)
        Method to set the books array equal to a value.
        Parameters:
        books, - the books array otherwise known as the bag of books

      • getNumBooks

        public int getNumBooks()
        Method to retrieve the amount of books in the bag.
        Returns:
        numBooks, the amount of books currently in the bag as an int value

      • setNumBooks

        public void setNumBooks(int numBooks)
        Method to set the number of books equal to a value of one's choosing.
        Parameters:
        numBooks, - the number of books in the bag

      • print

        public void print()
        Default print method that prints the list of books in the bag in its present order.

      • printByDate

        public void printByDate()
        Print method that prints the list of books in the bag in ascending order by date published. Calls a method that sorts the books by date published before printing.

      • printByNumber

        public void printByNumber()
        Print method that prints the list of books in the bag in ascending order by serial number. Calls a method that sorts the books by serial number before printing.
